Language.Text: [D]onate Item

You are docked at a habitat made out of shipping containers. Children bounce off the bulkheads in zero-G while maintenance workers repair leaky seals and balky machinery. The station master approaches you:
"Traveling the universe, yeah? Why don't you spare some items for us!"

You are docked at a habitat made out of shipping containers. Children bounce off the bulkheads in zero-G while maintenance workers repair leaky seals and balky machinery. The station master approaches you:
"We don't get many pilgrims visiting around here. I'll make you a deal: donate supplies to us and I'll give you some information in exchange."
Language.String: "Everything's quiet around here at the moment."
Language.Text: "If you're hunting Arco Vaughn, I know where you can find him. He has a habitat deep in the outer system. I'll give you his coordinates, but don't say where you got them."
"%ObjName% in this system has %itemName%. I'll give you the coordinates and you can take it from there."
"%ObjName% in this system has been raiding stations all year. No one will miss it. I'll give you the coordinates and you can do what you want."
"Yeah, there is a Korolov station in this system. I'll program the coordinates into your computer."
"I can point you to %objName%. I'll enter the coordinates into your computer."
The station master grabs you and speaks softly in your ear:\n\n
"The Charon pirates are a menace. They have bases in almost every system and they prey on defenseless freighters."
"If you need a contact in the Black Market find the Aleksany brothers; they're always doing business in some fancy hotel."
"The anarchists don't bother us, but they really annoy the Corporations: they're always stealing their fancy ROMs."
"Stay away from the Abbasid fortresses. Those fanatics will shoot you rather than let you get close."
"The Urak warlords are another nutty group, but their armor and weapons are pretty good."
"Hiro is the best hacker in the 'verse. He's created some fancy ROMs that even the cyber corporations can't figure out."
You have no items to give.

"We are not interested in %itemNames%.
"Give us food, fuel, or medicine and we'll give you information in exchange."
"We'd happily give you information in exchange for at least %itemName%. Unfortunately, you do not have that many."
"We'll happily give you information in exchange for at least %itemName%."

How many %items% do you wish to give?
(You must give at least %minCount%.)
"Thanks for the donation. We don't have any good information right now, but if we get any we'll let you know!"
"Interested in that, huh? Well I think I can help, but you'll have to help us first. Donate some supplies to us and I'll tell you what I know. Fair?"
"Thank you for donating supplies to us. What do you want to know?"
"What do you want to know?"
"Sorry, we don't know anything."
